column2: name
column8: template name

column2: Rough in
column8: ITR No.05 - Rough in

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Area clear, tidy and accessible
Rough in all lighting feeds and label on plan
Rough in of all lighting circuits- inc Emg/Exits and sensors
Rough in of all external lights
Rough in all power feeds and label on plan
Rough in of all power circuits
Check for clashes with other services
Assess all relevent drawings to ensure cables are in appropriate location.
Ensure area is left clean
Make sure any junctions are left in an accessible area and clearly marked on relevent plans/uploaded to conqa
Power plans are uploaded with location of feeds
Lighting plans are uploaded with location of feeds including dali route.
Fit Off
column8: ITR No.07 - Fit Off

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Area clear, tidy and accessible
Ensure danger tags have up to date contact & isolation details
LOCK OFF & TAG circuits that require isolation (Ensure key is with supervisor)
Test circuits to ensure they are isolated
Area clear, tidy and accessible
Fit off all Lights
Fit off all Sensors and SET TIME TO MINIMUM
Fit off all EX/EMG’s
Label all EX/EMG’s as per plan number
Fit off all GPOs
Fit off of all isolators (signs, hand dryers, hws)
Ensure all fit off has been ticked off on plans once completed
Ensure area is left clean
Switchboard Commissioning
column8: ITR No.12 - Switchboard Commissioning

column2: Details
Prior To Energising All Personnel Involved To Be Inducted Into Energisation Procedure And All Steps Undertaken To Ensurecompliance With This Procedure
Place all required signage and barricading and have LV rescue kit on standby.
Refer To As Installed Drawings
Obtain Copy Of Switchboard Schedule And Schematic Drawings
Mark Up Any Additions Or Deletions Found Whilst Commissioing
Complete Visual Checks
Refer To Mandatory Testing From As/Nzs 3000:2018 8.3.3 Below
Complete Mandatory Tests Using Metrel Tester, Save And Log Results On Tester
Any Failed Results To Be Rectified Saved And Logged On Tester
Ensure Correct Opertation Of All Control/Equipment Installed In Switchboard
Ensure Vast Witness Test Has Been Completed
Ensure Escutcheons, Pole Fillers, Fixing Screws Are Reinstated
Ensure No Access To Live Parts
Complete Switchboard Schedules On Vast Template, Install And Fix To Allocated Postion In Switchboard
Download Test Results From Metrel Tester And Save To Project Folder
Complete Certificate Of Electrical Safety And Save To Project Folder
Cutout of Ceilings & Walls
column8: ITR No.02 - Cutout of Ceilings & Walls

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Confirm sizes off all fittings prior to cut out
Cut out for all sensors, EX/EMG and light fittings
Consult supervisor before cutting a patch of is a mistake is made
Cut out items on joinery to the joinery plans
Cut out GPO's
Cut out bathrooms and other wet areas to relevent wet area plans
Ensure kitchen outlets are in correct position (where applicable)
Locate all cables
Install Fire Boxes and hit all 4 tabs in
Fire caulk ( if applicable )
For AV power and data, consult relevent AV plans and coordinate with AV contractor
FIT OFF ALL 413'S + QC'S + CEILING ROSES TO LIGHT FITTINGS THAT REQUIRE THEM
Decommission Temporary Power Board
column8: ITP No.20 - Decommission Temporary Power Board

column2: Details
Determine what the temporary board is controlling and confirm what action is required before board can be decommissioned.
De-commission form issued to builder, 48 hours notice to be given
Sign off builders checklist
Safety Committee Inspection
Final approval to be given by builder
Perform voltage test to ensure power supply has been isolated
Disconnect supply cables
Fire sealing of penetrations
Remove temporary board
Update temporary power board register
Installion of Electrical & Communication Pits
column8: ITP No.29 - Installion of Electrical & Communication Pits

column2: Details
Inspect pits for any damage on arrival to site
Mark out pit locations and alignment/arrangement
Check finished heights of pits against civil drawings/finished floor height
Erect pedestrian barricading
Excavate ground around pits as required
Place bedding material as per pit installation requirements
Cut out pit entry as required
Install pits in ground (using correct lifting equipment)
Check finished heights of pits against civil drawings
Install relevant conduits
Backfill and reinstatement of ground
Check stabilised FCR backfill 200mm below proposed road level, compacted FCR above that
Installation of Temporary Power Board
column8: ITP No.19 - Installation of Temporary Power Board

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Area accessible & ready
Locate & fix into position, bolt temporary board down with at least 2 fixings
Install submains cabling as appropriate eg: glands/tray/duct
Install lugs and terminate

Any cables not terminated prior to energisation must be removed from cubicle at origin and have ends covered in heat shrink. At destination cables must be covered in heat shrink and be contrained in a junction box
Clearly identify services
When ready to energise proceed in accordance with energisation procedure
Energise & record results on Vast RCD test sheet
Install A3 laminated sign on face of temp board with floor plan and where the board is fed from
Update Temporary Power Board register & save to project folder/design control/temp const.
Lodge non prescribed certificate of electrical safety
RCBO'S must be fully tested initially and then tested every month with results recorded and c/b’s labelled
Construction Wiring, Installation, Test and Tag & Removal
column8: ITP No.14 - Construction Wiring, Installation, Test and Tag & Removal

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Area accessible & ready
Refer to temporary wiring setout plan
CABLING MUST BE SUPPORTED AND PROTECTED FROM DAMAGE. CONSTRUCTION WIRING TAPE MUST BE FITTED AT EVERY 5 METRES. TEMPORARY WIRING MUST NOT BE INSTALLED WITH PERMANENT CABLING
Fit off plug base and or powerpoint/isolator
Install light fitting, exit/emg, power
Terminate cable to temp board. Ensure temp board is isolated! Test Test Test
Test & commission
Lodge non prescribed certificate of electrical safety
In Slab Conduits
column8: ITR No.09 - In Slab Conduits

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Determine origin and destination
Check clear of other services, penetrations etc
Check cable size to verify conduit size
Check if expansion joints are required
Mark out positions of junction boxes and penerations whee necessary
Install bar chairs where necessary
Install junction boxes and penetrations where necessary
Install junction boxes and glue conduits
Tie conduits securely at all joints and midpoints
Ensure all conduits are 50mm above deck
Ensure floor boxes and conduits into the FB are secured and photos of each one are uploaded
Mark up drawing of conduit runs
Observe conduits when concrete is being poured
Installing Underground Services (Electrical)
column8: ITR No.33 - Installing Underground Services (Electrical)

column2: Details
Inspect conduit material to check that it meets material specifications
Check conduit alignment as per plans
Set out marked, and all services located
Erect pedetrian barricading as per plan
Check excavation depth against proposed road level
Excavate to the trench as per plan
Place specified bedding material in trench
Placement of conduit of specified size in accordance with specifications/drawings
Install service hangers around conduits at every 500mm intervals
Backfill over conduit and install ORANGE under ground tape
Install cover slabs over conduit
Installing Underground Services (Comms)
column8: ITR No.33C - Installing Underground Services (Comms)

column2: Details
Inspect conduit material to check that it meets material specifications
Check conduit alignment as per plans
Set out marked, and all services located
Erect pedetrian barricading as per plan
Check excavation depth against proposed road level
Excavate to the trench as per plan
Place specified bedding material in trench
Placement of conduit of specified size in accordance with specifications/drawings
Install service hangers around conduits at every 500mm intervals
Backfill over conduit and install WHITE underground tape
Mains and Sub Mains
column8: ITR No.14 - Mains and Sub Mains

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Measure cable runs with appropriate accurate measuring instrument eg: tape measure, wheel, rope in conduit
Confirm length of cable
Install cable in applicable method eg: cable stands, electric winch, pulleys etc
Any cable not terminated immediately must have the end taped covering the bare copper
Trefoil (refer to details on back for all options) cables and tie cables to support system
Check cable requirements for cable identification and install
Structured Cabling Rough In
column8: ITP No.07 - Structured Cabling Rough In

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
REFER APPROVED DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATION.
INSTALL CABLE SUPPORT OR CONDUIT WHERE REQUIRED.
VERIFY CORRECT CABLE TYPE.
REFER TO APPROVED DRAWINGS FOR CABLE NUMBERING SEQUENCE RELEVANT TO FINAL FIT OFF SEQUENCE & RECORD
INSTALL CABLE WITHIN OR ON CABLE SUPPORT SYSTEMS MAINTAINING MIN SEGREGATIONS, ENSURE VELCRO CABLE TIES ARE USED AS PER SPEC
FORM CABLES INTO RELEVANT FIT-OFF GROUPS AT THE CABINET END.
Light and Power Fit Off
column8: ITR No.18 - Light and Power Fit Off

column2: Bakelite & Power
CHECK DRAWINGS FOR QUANTITY, BRAND TYPE AND COLOUR
WET AREAS to be above 300 from FFL- UNDER 40L SINK to be 150mm/400mm rule- OVER 40L SINK to be 500mm/1000mm rule
FIT OFF AND FIX SWITCHES WITH NO MORE THAN 100mm SINGLE INSULATION BEHIND WALL
FIT OFF AND FIX GPO’S WITH NO MORE THAN 100mm SINGLE INSULATION BEHIND WALL
ALL METAL STUDS ARE EARTHED TO THE NEAREST GPO
FIT OFF FINAL APPLIANCES WITH PHOTOS
COVER PLATES (IF REQUIRED)
Light Fittings
DELIVERY CHECK FOR DAMAGE AND CORRECT QUANTITIES
PLUG IN OR FIT OFF LIGHT / PLUG BASE
INSTALL LIGHT FITTING
INSTALL LAMPS AND DIFFUSER
CLEAN FITTING, LAMP DIFFUSER
Switchboard Installation and Terminate Submains
column8: ITR No.16 - Switchboard Installation and Terminate Submains

column2: Details
DELIVERY CHECK FOR DAMAGE, PAINT FINISH, DIMENSIONS AND DOORS AGAINST APPROVED SHOP DRAWING
LOCATE & FIX INTO POSITION
INSTALL SUBMAINS CABLING AS APPROPRIATE EG. GLANDS, TRAY, DUCT
INSTALL LUGS AND TERMINATE ONCE INSULATION RESISTANCE AND POLARITY TESTS HAVE BEEN CONDUCTED

ANY CABLES NOT TERMINATED PRIOR TO ENERGISATION MUST BE REMOVED FROM CUBICLE AT ORIGIN AND HAVE ENDS COVERED IN HEATSHRINK. AT DESTINATION CABLES MUST BE COVERED IN HEATSHRINK AND BE CONTAINED IN A JUNCTION BOX
CLEAN & VACUUM
ORGANISE INPECTION BY INSPECTOR. LODGE PRESCRIBED / NON PRESCRIBED (AS APPLICABLE) CERTIFICATE OF ELECTRICAL SAFETY (IF REQUIRED).
CLEARLY IDENTIFY SERVICES
WHEN READY TO ENERGISE PROCEED IN ACCORDANCE WITH ENERGISATION PROCEDURE
ENERGIZE & RECORD RESULTS

INSTALL SUB CIRCUIT CABLING IN ACCORDANCE WITH DB SCHEDULE AND TERMINATE. if circuit not complete at the other end, it must not be terminated BUT PLACED IN A JUNCTION BOX AT FIELD END AND IN CONNECTORS AT dISTRIBUTION BOARD END.
CLEAN & VACUUM
RECORD RELEVANT INFORMATION AND ANY CHANGES ON DB SCHEDULE. AND RETURN TO ADMINISTRATOR/OFFICE FOR COMMISSIONING TEAM
SUB-CIRCUIT CABLING FIT OFF
column8: ITP No.13 - SUB-CIRCUIT CABLING FIT OFF

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
TEST & ENSURE SUB CIRCUIT CABLING IS NOT LIVE PRIOR TO FIT OFF
TERMINATE CABLE TO OUTLET OR PLUG BASE, CHECK CORRECT CONNECTIONS AND FIX TO SURFACE, IF CIRCUIT CAN NOT BE FULLY TERMINATED A JUNCTION BOX MUST BE INSTALLED WHERE REQUIRED
CLEAN AREA AS REQUIRED
RECORD ANY RELEVANT INFORMATION ON DRAWINGS.
EXIT & EMERGENCY INSTALLATION & TESTING
column8: ITP No.16 - EXIT & EMERGENCY INSTALLATION & TESTING

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
DELIVERY CHECK FOR DAMAGE AND CORRECT QUANTITIES
COORDINATE LOCATIONS WITH OTHER SERVICES
PLUG IN OR FIT OFF LIGHT, FIT OFF DATA CABLE IF REQUIRED
INSTALL LAMP & DIFFUSER AND CLEAN FITTING
INSTALL EMERGENCY BARCODE TO FITTING AND TO DRAWINGS (IF REQUIRED)- UP LOAD PHOTO OF PLAN WITH LABELS
NUMBER FITTINGS AS PER VAST SHOP DRAWINGS.
UPDATE ANY CHANGES FOR AS BUILTS
STRUCTURED CABLING TESTING CERTIFIED SYSTEM
column8: ITP No.09 - STRUCTURED CABLING TESTING CERTIFIED SYSTEM

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
REFER TO INSTALLED DRAWINGS
Test terminations using COPPER STRUCTURED CABLING tester AND LOG RESULTS
RECTIFY ANY FAILED RESULTS, RE-TEST AND LOG
LABEL FRAMES AND PATCH PANELS
COMPLETE PATCH PANEL SCHEDULE
DOWNLOAD RESULTS FROM TESTER TO PROJECT FOLDER
STRUCTURED CABLING FIT OFF
column8: ITP No.08 - STRUCTURED CABLING FIT OFF

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
VISUAL CHECK ENSURING CABLE TO BE FITTED OFF IN CORRECT POSITION.
SELECTION OF CORRECT TOOL TO BE USED FOR TERMINATION TYPE.
ENSURE CABLES ARE STRIPPED NO MORE THAN THE SPECIFIED DISTANCE. CHECK TERMINATIONS AT COMPLETION FOR COLOUR CODE AND SEQUENCE.
ATTACH WRAP AROUND LABEL TO CABLE NO MORE THAN 60MM FROM THE JACK. ENSURING CORRECT NUMBER SEQUENCE.
DRESS CABLES TO FINAL LOCATION. ENSURE VELCRO STRAPS FOR CAT 6 CABLING
INSTALL JACK INTO WORKSTATION OR WALL OUTLET.
INSTALL PATCH PANEL INTO CABINET LOOM CABLES TO THE BACK OF THE PATCH PANEL. TIE INTO POSITION USING VELCRO STRIP AND/OR CABLE TIES SUPPLIED.
PATCH OUTLETS TO HARDWARE DEVICES WHERE APPLICABLE AND CHECK FOR CORRECT OPERATION.
LABEL OUTLET ENSURING CORRECT NUMBER SEQUENCE
COMPLETE CERTIFICATION AS REQUIRED
Installing Light Pole Cages
column8: ITR No.34 - Installing Light Pole Cages

column2: Details
INSPECT CAGES FOR ANY DAMAGE PROIR TO INSTALLATION
SET OUT LIGHT POLE LOCATION, ALIGNMENT AND HEIGHT AS SPECIFIED
ERECT PEDESTRIAN BARRICADING AS PER PLAN
EXCAVATE AS PER PLAN
PLACE SPECIFIED BEDDING MATERIAL AS PER REQUIREMENT
INSTALL LIGHT POLE CAGES AND CONDUITS AS REQUIRED
RE-CHECK FINSHED HEIGHT AS PER CIVIL DRAWINGS
POUR CONCRETE FOOTING WITH SPECIFIED MPA
CLEAN UP AND BARRICADE WORK AREA
Installing Underground Pits
column8: ITR No.35 - Installing Underground Pits

column2: Details
INSPECT PITS FOR ANY DAMAGE PROIR TO INSTALLATION
SET OUT PIT LOCATION, ALIGNMENT AND HEIGHT AS SPECIFIED
ERECT PEDESTRIAN BARRICADING AS PER PLAN
EXCAVATE AS PER PLAN
PLACE SPECIFIED BEDDING MATERIAL AS PER REQUIREMENT
INSTALL PIT AND CONDUITS AS REQUIRED
RE-CHECK FINSHED HEIGHT AS PER CIVIL DRAWINGS
BACKFILL AND REINSTATE GROUND AS REQUIRED
Cable Tray Installation
column8: ITR No.10 - Cable Tray Installation

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
CO-ORDINATE WITH OTHER SERVICES (CHECK FOR ANY CLASHES)
CONFIRM SIZE OF CABLE TRAY
INSTALL FIXINGS AND SUPPORTS AS NEEDED
INSTALL CABLE TRAY
COMPLETE SKETCH/MARK UP DRAWING FOR FUTURE AS BUILTS
Documents
column8: Add Documents

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Field Commissioning
column8: ITR No.41 - Field Commissioning

column2: Details
Energisation permit completed prior to energisation
Address site at prestart and inform of no access to area under commissioning.
Place all relevent signage and barricading and have LV rescue kit on standby.
Visual check of DB serviced areas
Dead Testing
Live Testing
Report any issues to supervisor and generate plan to rectify (if any)
Perform a 2 hour test on all exit and emergency lighting (allow time for initial charging of batteries)
Lighting Control Rough In
column8: ITP No.43 - Lighting Control Rough In

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Area clear, tidy and accessible
Plan lighting control route in conjunction with supervisor.
Rough in lighting control cable to all sensors and switches.
All lighting control must be roughed in point to point, daisy chain style (no star points, two cables at each point only).
Lighting control route must be drawn clearly and precisely on dedicated plan, if there is a change or revision, a new plan must be created and superseded written on old plan.
Upload lighting control plan to Conqa, use this spot as a place to upload any and all plan/revision of this drawing.
Rough in of all booster cables applicable to the lighting control system (1.5mm2 twin active)
Ensure all cables are clearly labled and are to the appropriate length.
Ensure area is left clean
Lighting Control Fit off
column8: ITR No.44 - Lighting Control Fit off

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Area clear, tidy and accessible
Dediacte one person to be in charge of lighting control fitoff.
Always use the correct tools to fitoff the lighting control equiptment
Fitoff all sensors
Fit off all untumbra switches
Stick barcode of sensor/switch onto the designated plan in the location of the sensor/switch
Make sure all installed items are clean and undamaged.
Lighting Control Commissioning
column8: ITR No.45 - Lighting Control Commissioning

column2: Details
Drawing Rev No.
Before lighting control programmer
Area clear, tidy and accessible
Complete testing and commissioning of general light and power.
Once lighting commissioning is complete, assess all sensors light up red upon registering movement.
Ensure all switches are illuminated.
Put Dali universe in flash mode, all lights on that universe should be flashing.
Address any issues
With lighting control programmer
Explain which fittings are to be programmed and what they should be programmed to do
Walk around with programmer, show him the DB feeding the lighting and control modules.
Be on standby for any rectification works needed brought up by the programmer.
Visually see all working as intended before he leaves site.
